p:
MERS is a respiratory disease produced by MERS coronavirus. Since September 2012, 2494 people were diagnosed with MERS coronavirus (MERS-CoV), causing 858 deaths (from WHO).
23 Clinical symptoms vary from mild to severe. They usually begin with fever, cough, chills, sore throat, myalgia, and arthralgia, with rapid progress to dyspnea and pneumonia in the first week (epidemic and emerging coronavirus, SARS, and MERS). The mean incubation period was 5.2 days; the fatality rate was 34.4%. A study reviewed 11 pregnant women infected with MERS-CoV; all the pregnant women were symptomatic, six (54%) patients were admitted to ICU, three (27%) patients died during the hospitalization, and three (27%) infants died.
24, 25
